editCollective.host.pending: You have applied to be hosted by {host} on {date}. Your application is being reviewed. As soon as the host accepts, you will be able to start collecting money for your collective.

editCollective.host.balance: Your host currently holds {balance} on behalf of your collective.
editCollective.host.change.balanceNotEmp: If you would like to change host, you first need to empty your balance by filing expenses or transfering funds to another collective.
editCollective.host.change.removeFirst: Once removed, you won't be able to accept donations anymore. But you will be able to select another host for your collective.
collective.edit.host.noHost.title: No host
collective.edit.host.noHost.description: Without a host, you can't collect money. But you can still use the other features of Open Collective: filing expenses, posting updates, and creating events.
collective.edit.host.createHost.title: Use your own host
collective.edit.host.createHost.descript: You can create your own host as an individual or as an organization. You will be responsible for keeping custody of the funds raised by this collective and for paying out the expenses that have been approved.
collective.edit.host.findHost.title: Apply to an existing host
collective.edit.host.findHost.descriptio: With this option, everything is taking care of for you. No need to create a new bank account, no need to worry about accounting and invoicing. All of that is being taken care of by an existing non profit organization that acts as your fiscal host. Note: most hosts charge a commission to cover the administrative overhead.
collective.edit.host.suggestedHosts.desc: Based on the tags of your collective ({tags})
collective.edit.host.suggestedHosts.empt: No suggestion. Please look at all available hosts or consider creating a new host.

paymentMethod.whyUnknownTitle: Why is my credit card not showing up?
paymentMethod.whyUnknown: This subscription was created using an early version of our site when we didn't store credit card numbers. We suggest that you update this subscription with a newer credit card.
pledge.stats: {orgCount, plural, =0 {} one {# organization} other {# organizations}} {both, plural, =0 {} one { and }} {userCount, plural, =0 {} one {# individual } other {# individuals }} {totalCount, plural, one {has } other {have }} already pledged a total of {amount} {currency}
pledge.definition:
A pledge is a way for the community to show interest in supporting a cause or project that is not yet on
              Open Collective, just like {collective}. This will incentivize them to create a
              collective for their activities and offer you much more visibility on how your money is spent to advance
              their cause. Once they create it, you will receive an email to ask you to fulfill your pledge.
pledge.ownerDetails:
You can claim this collective! You will be able to start raising funds and manage your expenses
                  transparently. We will contact the organizations and individuals who made commitment for them to
                  fulfill their pledge.
update.publish.backers: Your update will be sent to {n} backers
redeem.form.code.label: Gift card code
redeem.card.info: It's easy! Just enter your name, email address and gift code. We will create an account for you if you don't already have one. You'll be able to select the gift card as the payment method when making a contribution.
redeem.card.authenticated: You are currently authenticated. Sign Out first if you want to redeem with another account.
redeem.card.success.title: You are one step away from supporting open collectives.
redeem.card.success.instructions: We’ve sent an email to {email} with instructions to verify your new Open Collective account and credit it with the amount of your gift card.

createPledge.why:
If the cause or collective that you want to support is not yet on Open Collective, you can make a
                pledge. This will incentivize them to create an open collective for their activities and offer you much
                more visibility on how your money is spent to advance their cause.
createPledge.onceTheyCreateIt:
Once they create it (and verify that they own the URL you’ll enter in this form), you will receive an
                email to ask you to fulfill your pledge.
createPledge.conditions:
At the moment, you can only pledge for Open Source projects with a GitHub repository or organization. We
                request the project to have a least 100 stars on GitHub!
createPledge.priviledge:
You’ve earned the priviledge to name and describe this awesome cause. We’ll create a pledged
                        collective page for it so other people can find it and pledge to it too.
createPledge.name: Name
createPledge.githubURL: GitHub URL: repository or organization with at least 100 stars!
create.pledge.stats: by {orgCount, plural, =0 {} one {# sponsor} other {# sponsors}} {both, plural, =0 {} one {and }} {userCount, plural, =0 {} one {# backer } other {# backers }}
createPledge.faq.what:
A pledge allows supporters (companies and individuals) to pledge
                funds towards a collective that hasn’t been created yet. If you can’t find a collective you want to
                support, pledge to it!
createPledge.faq.whatHappens:
Once someone makes a pledge to a collective, we automatically create a pledged collective. We don’t spam
                folks, so please help us reach out to the community via twitter / github or, if you can, via email.
createPledge.faq.pay: Once that pledged collective is claimed, we will email you to fulfill your pledge.
createPledge.faq.howToClaimSummary: How do I claim a pledged collective?
createPledge.faq.howToClaim:
You’ll need to authenticate with the github profile that owns / admins that project. Just click on the
                Claim Collective button in the pledged collective. We will be rolling out other forms of authentication
                in the future.
updates.new.title: New update
updates.create.login: You need to be logged in as a core contributor of this collective to be able to create an update.
home.carousel.raiseMoneyHeading: Raise money online with recurring subscriptions.
home.carousel.raiseMoneyDetails: Connect with the Open Collective community and raise the funds required to sustain your community.
home.carousel.contributeHeading: All are welcome to join & contribute.
home.carousel.contributeDetails: Everyone can contribute to your open collective. All you need is for people to believe in your mission.
home.carousel.transparencyHeading: Show how the money is spent.
home.carousel.transparencyDetails: Every contribution helps you support your collective. Open Collective shows everyone how these financial contributions are earned and spent.
home.carousel.missionHeading: A bottom - up group where anyone can become a core contributor.
home.carousel.missionDetails: The mission is what persists and unites you with your community. Leaders can change over time.
home.presentation:
The Internet generation needs organizations that reflect who we are; where anybody can contribute to
                    a shared mission; where leaders can easily change; and where money flows in full transparency.
                    Create an Open Collective for your community.
home.joinFor: Join the movement for a world with more open, transparent, and sustainable communities.
home.participate:
There are many ways to participate: create an open collective, become a host, make a financial
                contribution, attend an event or simply share the love by showing others how they can benefit from
                operating as an open community. Here’s how:
home.transparency: A group of people with a shared mission that operates in full transparency
home.createFor:
Create an open collective for your group and leverage the power of the community to live up to your
                  mission.
home.greatCompanies: Great companies supporting great collectives with
home.orgSupport: Support collectives on behalf of your organization.
home.invoice:
You'll get an invoice for every financial contribution your company makes as well as a monthly
                    report.
home.onboard: If you’re looking to onboard and financially support an initiative through Open Collective, {letUsKnowLink} and we’ll gladly set them up and get them going.
home.givingBack: For those who believe in giving back
home.joinAndDiscover:
Join Open Collective and discover the different initiatives that need your support. Embrace the
                  mission that drives them and contribute to their group effort.
home.buildingTogether: Building Open Collective together to get further, faster
home.devOpenSource:
Are you a developer who believes in supporting open and welcoming communities? Open Collective is open
                  source (MIT License) so anyone can contribute code or report issues publicly.
home.goal:
Our goal is to provide all communities around the world the software that they need to operate as open
                  and transparent collectives. We want to enable them to thrive in the same way that WordPress enabled
                  millions of blogs to exist.
home.specialThanks: Special thanks to all of you who already contributed in some way!
home.github: Check out our Github organization to find out more
home.umbrella: Help provide the umbrella legal entities open collectives need to raise funds
home.hostDetails2:
by becoming a host of open collectives in your city or your
                  industry. Hosts are acting as fiscal sponsors. They collect the money on behalf of the collectives and
                  enable them to issue invoices. They are mutualising the legal and accounting overhead that come with
                  creating and maintaining a legal entity so that the open collectives that they host can focus on their
                  mission.
home.speadDescription:
Do you know people or organizations that will benefit from an open structure and a transparent
                  operation? Let them know that Open Collective exists!
home.discoverOpenSourceProjects: Discover the Open Source projects your organization is using that need financial support.
home.backYourStack: BackYourStack is a community project initiated by Open Collective.
openSourceApply.GithubRepositories.title: Pick a repository
openSourceApply.GithubRepositories.descr: Select a project you wish to create a collective for. Only repositories with at least 100 stars are eligible.
openSourceApply.title: For Open Source projects
openSourceApply.description.p1: When you do an open source project the last thing you want to worry about is creating a legal entity, keeping track of accounting and other tax reports, just because a company wants to support you financially but needs an invoice for that.
openSourceApply.description.p2: That's why we have created an umbrella non profit (the {osclink}) that can host your open source community. You just need to have at least 100 stars on Github, operate in full transparency and respect our {communityguidelineslink}.
openSourceApply.description.p3: 50% of the commission (so 5% out of the 10%) goes to finance this non profit and pay for legal and accounting and other expenses that can be mutualized for the benefit of the open source community at large.
contribute.publicMessage.placeholder: Motivate others to contribute in 140 characters :) ...
contributeFlow.successMessage: {fromCollectiveName} is now a member of {collectiveName}'s '{tierName}' tier.
contributeSuccess.discover: Discover other related collectives to support:
redeem.subtitle.line1: Open Collective helps communities - like open source projects, meetups and social movements - raise funds spend them transparently.
redeemed.subtitle.line1: The card has been added to your account.
redeemed.subtitle.line2: You can now donate to any collective of your choice.
redeemed.backyourstack: or discover the open source projects that your organization is depending on and that need funding on {link}
redeemed.suggestions: or you can choose from these awesome collectives that are doing great work:
